wikipedia_page.main: Sir David Alan Hopwood  (born 19 August 1933) is a British microbiologist and geneticist.

response: *  1933   – David Hopwood, English microbiologist and geneticist

Present faculty include former IPCC Chairman Sir Robert Watson;‘WATSON, Sir Robert (Tony)’, Who's Who 2014, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 2014 scientists Sir David Hopwood,‘HOPWOOD, Sir David (Alan)’, Who's Who 2014, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 2014 Phil Jones,‘JONES, Prof. Philip Douglas’, Who's Who 2014, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 2014 Corinne Le Quéré, Jonathan D. G. Jones,‘JONES, Jonathan Dallas George’, Who's Who 2014, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 2014 Enrico Coen,‘COEN, Prof. Enrico Sandro’, Who's Who 2014, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 2014 Frederick Vine‘VINE, Prof. Frederick John’, Who's Who 2014, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 2014 and Peter Liss;‘LISS, Prof. Peter Simon’, Who's Who 2014, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 2014
* David Hopwood, banker, born in Billericay

* Sir David Hopwood, John Innes Professor of Genetics at the University of East Anglia from 1968 to 1998, President of the Genetical Society from 1985 to 1987, and of the Society of General Microbiology from 2000 to 2003

He joined the John Innes Centre in 1969 and began working with David Hopwood. His group developed the ΦC31 bacteriophage into a series of cloning vectors that are used to isolate genes in Streptomyces.
